summary: This document is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office staff discussing the drafting of a reply brief, specifically Part I regarding the issue of pseudonyms. It shows internal coordination on legal strategy and editing.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: The sender of the initial email attaching a draft of Part I of the reply brief regarding pseudonyms.

persons.name: Janis
persons.context: Provided minor comments on the draft reply brief along with another team member.

connections.person1: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
connections.description: Both are part of the legal team working on the reply brief, with Janis providing feedback on the draft.

events.title: Drafting of Reply Brief Part I
events.description: Internal email correspondence regarding the editing and review of Part I of a reply brief, focusing on the issue of pseudonyms.
personsInvolved: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York

locations.context: Office address of the Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

keyFacts: The document is an internal email chain from October 27, 2021, discussing the drafting of a legal reply brief.
Part I of the reply brief specifically addresses the issue of pseudonyms, indicating this was a point of legal contention.
The correspondence shows coordination between prosecutors and legal staff (including 'Janis') on editing and strategy.
The email mentions adjustments to a section on 'MV-4' and plans to create a standalone section on 'Prior Consistents'.
The document originates from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, indicating ongoing federal prosecution activity.
